turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: When we had trouble before it was different.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: You don't like the way things are, I don't like the way things

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: What do you want to do?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Maybe we should split up... I'll cut the money with you.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: We'll grab a room for tonight then you go out tomorrow and buy yourself some new clothes, pick some up for me... Grab some food now, paper bag it, we eat in the room.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: You've got all the answers. What about when they find the body on the train?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: When they find it, they find it.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: No... there's a couple of things I'm still working on.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: There may be a hunting party.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Why, there's nothing on the news?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: If Beynon bought him out, and he talked then maybe Beynon's boys will be waiting for us in El Paso.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: I think you liked it with him.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Maybe. At least I got to him.  Where do we go from here?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: That would be the first time.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: When are you going to learn?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I did I killed a man.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: From now on you just shut up and do as you're told.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: If I hadn't killed Beynon., you would have.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: You can't trust anything these days.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I'll tell you something, Doc. One day you're going to have to trust somebody...

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: I trust...  Want to see what I trust... In God we trust...  The word's on every bill!!!

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: You keep it up and it won't matter how far we get away, because it's going to be all over between you and me. Do you understand that? There won't be anything left.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I think so... I don't know.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Do what I tell you, it's not a game.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: It's all a game, don't bother me.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: We better stick here till tonight.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I don't want to hear it.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Listen to me. It's hard enough.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Look, what you said yesterday... I guess that was right. It isn't worth anything if we don't make it together.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I don't think we can any more... If we ever get out of here, maybe I should take off...

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: We've come a lot of miles. But we're not close to anything.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I always thought jails make people hard. Not you. You're just not tough enough to forget about Beynon. I chose you, not him.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Either we pick it up or else we leave it right here. We got to go one way or another.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: You want to try with me?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Things can't get much worse can they?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: We get to Mexico, we can have a life.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: That's all I want... It's the only thing I have ever wanted.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: We've got some food coming, should be here any minute.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Great. I'm going to sleep twelve hours.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Ten. Laughlin's going to take us across at four A.M.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Jeep. There's a dry river bed fifteen miles east. He takes us to the Mexican side, drops us off at the airfield by breakfast... we've got a 9 o'clock flight.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Get in the shower. You'll feel okay.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Laughlin. He's always got his family around... that wife and kid of his have to stand by his side to make sure he stays off the juice and horses.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: If they are not here, he must have sent them away.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Get your clothes on, move your butt.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Where do we go from here?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: I don't know, airport I guess.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: They will have our description before we can get a plane.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: How long before this car's hot?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Are we going to make it?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Hell, I don't know... but we sure gave it a run.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Whatever happens... we're going all the way.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Yeah, why not? We're the good guys.

turns.speaker: SOLDIER
turns.text: Me, too. Got twenty-four days of furlough and I'm goin' home.

turns.speaker: SOLDIER
turns.text: Utah, the Bee-Hive state. I'm from Orem, right near Salt Lake ... Say, you wouldn't happen to be a Mormon, would you?

turns.speaker: SOLDIER
turns.text: Me, neither. There's about twelve people in the state that aren't Mormons and I'm one of them.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: That certainly makes you kind of special...

turns.speaker: SOLDIER
turns.text: You wouldn't be taking the train to Salt Lake, would you?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: STANDS AND PAUSES FOR A MOMENT.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I really hope you have a nice trip.

turns.speaker: SOLDIER
turns.text: Thanks. I hope yours is okay, too.

turns.speaker: SLIM
turns.text: Three years ago I dynamited some fish at the reservoir.

turns.speaker: SLIM
turns.text: That little job cost me a hundred dollars... didn't even get to keep the fish.

turns.speaker: SLIM
turns.text: Hope you get to where you're going.

turns.speaker: SLIM
turns.text: By the way, you're getting a hell of a car there, mister.

turns.speaker: SLIM
turns.text: One thing though... how do I explain this to my wife?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Tell her you robbed a bank...

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Sure can. I'd like an Invicta 12-gauge pump with the twenty-inch barrel.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: You're out of touch. Cops blew him up.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Just in case someone gets a shot off.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: I worked ten years without one, I don't need one now.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Chambers - Reilly. Time lock opens 20 minutes before they start doing business...

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: One-inch stuff on a three-number combination.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: I 'm handling the fine stuff. You're back up all the way...

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: I'll hang on to these. We don't need them till we get to Gollie«s. Okay. Any questions?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Aren't we going a little hard?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: What do you have in mind?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: It's just a walk-in bank. You don't have to be Dillinger for this one.

turns.speaker: LAUGHLIN
turns.text: Growing -- all of them - every day.  318, you'll be the only ones on the floor.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: My lady'11 come in in about five minutes. Have some food sent up in half an hour.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: When she gets here, have that kid of yours help her with the suitcase.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Mexico. I'd like to find a quiet place to cross.

turns.speaker: SLIM
turns.text: I guess you ain't gonna shoot me, are you?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Let's just get to the border.

turns.speaker: SLIM
turns.text: Sure thing, mister, it's coming right up. 'Bout an hour. Quiet crossing that is.

turns.speaker: SLIM
turns.text: Don't you want to go to the airport?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Listen... how much money did you make this year?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: How about if I buy your car for ten grand?

turns.speaker: SLIM
turns.text: And I keep my mouth shut?

turns.speaker: SLIM
turns.text: I don't report the car and I don't know either of you?

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: You're going to have to walk back to the border.

turns.speaker: SLIM
turns.text: Don't worry about me, I'll grab a cab... I can afford it, you know.

turns.speaker: DOC
turns.text: Well, I paid a hell of a price. Now for God's sake keep your mouth shut.

turns.speaker: SLIM
turns.text: Wish you hadn't said that. When Slim Canfield's lips are sealed, they're sealed.

turns.speaker: FRAN
turns.text: Just... tell us what you want.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: What kind of car do you have, Harold?

turns.speaker: FRAN
turns.text: A Ford... We have a Ford.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: That's good. That's very good. Now Harold, you go out and gas up the Ford, check the oil and tires, we don't want any problems on the road. One more thing... If anybody but you comes back...

turns.speaker: FRAN
turns.text: You do what he says, Harold.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: After you come back I'll listen while you make some phone calls, tell a few friends you've got to leave for a week or two... You have to call another Vet about the animals. You tell him to come over and take good care of them starting tomorrow... no slip-ups on that. They got to be looked after...

turns.speaker: FRAN
turns.text: I don't think you have to worry much about Harold. He won't do anything.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: How long have you been married?

turns.speaker: FRAN
turns.text: Something ought to loosen him up ... how comes we're going to El Paso, Rudy?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: I Just want to find a suitcase.

turns.speaker: HAROLD
turns.text: Collar bone is broken. No infection yet... the bandages should be changed twice a day.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: I got a nurse in mind.

turns.speaker: HAROLD
turns.text: The glucose will begin working in half an hour. You'll feel better then...

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: The three of us are going to do some traveling. We're going to take your car to El Paso.

turns.speaker: HAROLD
turns.text: That's not possible. We can't leave here... we've got all this.

turns.speaker: ALBERT
turns.text: Hello, Jack,  I don't know anything, Jack.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Yes, you do, Albert. Talk or I'll kill you.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: You can't get away from me, Albert.

turns.speaker: ALBERT
turns.text: I didn't know who Doreen was. Thought she was just another bird.

turns.speaker: ALBERT
turns.text: I dunno. He's got his ways. He knows Margaret.

turns.speaker: ALBERT
turns.text: No choice. I had a visit from somebody.

turns.speaker: ALBERT
turns.text: Cliff Brumby. He'd seen the film. He wanted to meet Doreen.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Do you want to be dead, Albert?

turns.speaker: ALBERT
turns.text: Last Sunday afternoon, Eric and two of his boys arrive with Frank and tell me that he's rumbled. Somehow, he's seen the film and was about to shoot his mouth off. They ask me for some whisky and start forcing it down his throat.  I thought they'd just duff him up a bit. Honest.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Did Eric know that Frank was my brother?

turns.speaker: ALBERT
turns.text: Yes, but listen. Christ, I didn't kill him.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: What's it got to do with you?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Well, he drove it into the river.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: He was drunk. Drunk as a lord.

turns.speaker: BRUMBY
turns.text: You know what the bloody time is!  It's two o'clock in the bloody morning!

turns.speaker: BRUMBY
turns.text: Bloody well tell me who sent you.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: You're a big man, but you're in bad shape. With me, it's a full- time job. Now behave yourself.

turns.speaker: BRUMBY
turns.text: A new venture of mine. It's going to be a restaurant.  Do you like it?

turns.speaker: BRUMBY
turns.text: Last night, after you'd gone, I did a little bit of asking around. Seeing as you weren't very forthcoming,  It seems that you are concerned about the death of your brother?  I got to thinking it would be nice if the bloke you were after was the same bloke I wanted off my back,  You know my life. Machines. The arcades. Nice business. Looks after itself. People put money in. I take it out. Not much rough stuff. It's a business that makes me very happy. But recently, I've had a spot of bother,  One of my lads gets a bit over- anxious and flogs some machines in a club that's already got some. The upshot is I've had to eat shit and stop flogging my machines to other clubs.  So far as I'm concerned, that's it. Apparently not. These people I've offended get the idea that it would be good to take over my whole outfit,  So I'm worried. I can't fight them  I haven't that kind of set-up. But I've got to fix them before they fix me. Trouble is, if I try and they find out, I'm dead.

turns.speaker: BRUMBY
turns.text: Five grand. It belongs to you. Along with a little name I'm going to give you.

turns.speaker: BRUMBY
turns.text: Kinnear. Cyril Kinnear.  Kinnear did it.

turns.speaker: BRUMBY
turns.text: I don't know. All I know is that people were shitting bricks up at his place last Saturday. Your brother's name was mentioned. Next day, he was dead.

turns.speaker: BRUMBY
turns.text: I don't know. That's all I was told.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Do me a favour. You don't really expect me to fix Kinnear on your say-so?  Just because they tried to get me on you last night, don't think you can pull the same trick. Stroll on.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Good afternoon, Mr Brumby. Carter exits.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: You shouldn't have shown the film to Frank.

turns.speaker: BRUMBY
turns.text: I had to. It was the only way I could get at them.

turns.speaker: THORPE
turns.text: I'd like a word with you, Jack.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: You stay in the car. I'll come and listen.  What you want to tell me, Thorpey?

turns.speaker: THORPE
turns.text: Train goes at four minutes past twelve. You've just got time.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: That's very kind of somebody. Who do I have to thank?  What happens if I miss the train?

turns.speaker: THORPE
turns.text: I've been asked to make sure you don't.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Oh, really. You're getting very optimistic in your old age, aren't you, Thorpey?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Who paid you to see me off?

turns.speaker: THORPE
turns.text: I can't Jack. How can I?

turns.speaker: THORPE
turns.text: He's got a new place at Burnham.

turns.speaker: THORPE
turns.text: On the Durham Road. The Pantiles.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: You must be joking,  Keep him away from the telephone. I'm going out for a bit.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Fine...  I want to talk to you.

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: She's nothing to do with me.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: What do you mean? You've been Frank's bird ever since her mother cleared off. You're closer to her than anyone.

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: No. No. It's not like that. I've got a husband, you know.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Hold it!   Hold it!  Who killed Frank, Margaret?

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: Killed?  I don't know anything about it.

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: I must go. I'm in a hurry.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: I want to talk to you later.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: How were things between you and Frank?

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: He was all right to me.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: But he was just another feller, wasn't he?

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: Yes. I can't help the way I am.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Why'd you see him so regular?

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: He was gentlemanly. I like that.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Once a week you like a gentleman?

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: Look, I'm me, right. You're not. We are what we are, like it or not.  Why all the bloody needle?

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: He wanted me to leave Dave and marry him. Last Friday I told him it wouldn't work. Dave would have killed us both!  He followed me home and kicked up a stink in the street,  I had to tell Frank I couldn't see him any more. It was getting too dodgy. That was on Sunday.  He said he'd kill himself. I was frightened what you might do.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: I don't believe you, Margaret. Frank wasn't like that.  I'm the villain in the family, remember?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: You bloody whore. Frank was too careful to die like that. Who killed him?

turns.speaker: GLENDA
turns.text: Yes. I met him last year.

turns.speaker: GLENDA
turns.text: Oh yes. When he came up on business.

turns.speaker: GLENDA
turns.text: He came to see Mr Kinnear.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: While he was here. You went about together?

turns.speaker: GLENDA
turns.text: He was here for four days.

turns.speaker: GLENDA
turns.text: Could you do me a favour?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Yeah, I'll do you a favour.

turns.speaker: GLENDA
turns.text: Could you please put my glass on the table?

turns.speaker: GLENDA
turns.text: You didn't know you had a fairy godmother, did you?

turns.speaker: GLENDA
turns.text: A fairy godmother, all of your own. Aren't you lucky?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: So where are we going, Princess?

turns.speaker: GLENDA
turns.text: To the demon king's castle, of course.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: How'd you know where I'd be?

turns.speaker: GLENDA
turns.text: You were seen parking your car. The demon king waves his wand and I was dispatched to bring you to him. Lucky for you I waited.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Very lucky, I should think. You're drunk!

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: He must have been pretty sure I'd come.

turns.speaker: GLENDA
turns.text: Oh, he was. He told me a magic spell that would make you come.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Who's setting you up in this place?

turns.speaker: GLENDA
turns.text: Don't worry. He's meeting the architects at the restaurant.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Aren't you scared Kinnear will find out?

turns.speaker: GLENDA
turns.text: He won't. He thinks I'm simple.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: What does he want that bloody great country place for?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Does Brumby get a kick out of that crap?

turns.speaker: GLENDA
turns.text: Especially when I play the lead.

turns.speaker: GLENDA
turns.text: That's why you waited for me.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: I want to give you an Oscar.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: The young girl. Who pulled her?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Is it one of Kinnear's films?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Then he must have pulled her.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Did my brother Frank find out?

turns.speaker: GLENDA
turns.text: Your brother? What you talking about?
